subjectCategories: LAW, POLITICAL SCIENCE AND SPACE POLICY
abstract: The principles and policies governing participation in the International Space Station are examined from a NASA perspective. The history of the program is reviewed; the most important aspects of the partnership concept (functional allocation, shared access, and interface commonality) are considered in detail; and the ongoing outfitting studies are briefly characterized. Major issues remaining to be negotiated include (1) the overall management structure; (2) the division of responsibilities for system design, integration, operation, and utilization; and (3) the sharing of operating costs.
title: International cooperation in the Space Station

organization.name: NASA Utilization and Performance Requirements Div.

publications.publicationName: Space Technology - Industrial and Commercial Applications
